inclusion.criterion: be excluded from the study if the undergoing standard PNL/mini-perc have purulent fluid in the initial puncture.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients with positive preoperative urine culture should be treated with suitable antibiotics based on the culture sensitivity result for at least 72 h before PCNL.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients who have negative urine culture should receive a single dose of broad spectrum antibiotic prophylaxis just prior to the procedure.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Under general anaesthesia, each patient is initially placed in the lithotomy position, and a 5 Fr or 6Fr ureteral catheter is inserted to the kidney and fixed with a 16 Fr Foley catheter.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The access tract is dilated with a fascial dilator from 8F up to 18F.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients were candidates for the tubeless procedure only when the following strict conditions were met: single percutaneous tract, absence of major perforation of collecting system and bleeding, complete stone clearance assessed by intraoperative nephroscopy and fluoroscopy at the end of the procedure.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Uncorrected coagulopathy and active urinary tract infection (UTI)
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Patients who underwent transplant or urinary diversion.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: A 5 months old male with undescended testis, undergoing PCNL for stone clearance. Normal renal function and ASA scoreⅠ to Ⅱ.
